warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend your arms out to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cow) and rounding it (cat). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Twist your torso to the left and right, keeping your hips stable. Perform 2 sets of 15 reps each side.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at the lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad. Use a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handles with palms facing each other.
2. Pull the handles down to your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, similar to the Wide Grip Lat Pull Down.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on engaging your lats and avoid using momentum to pull the bar down.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench. Adjust the bench angle to support your chest comfortably.
execution: 1. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported.
2. Grip the handles or dumbbells with palms facing down.
3. Pull the weight towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
5. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet braced against the platform.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handle with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Pull the handle towards your abdomen, keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, similar to the Chest Supported Row.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your chest firmly against the pad to isolate your back muscles effectively.

exercises.setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet braced against the platform.
execution: 1. Grip the handle with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Pull the handle towards your abdomen, keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with a wide grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing down.
2. Pull the bar towards your upper abdomen, keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, similar to the Cable Row.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a full range of motion to maximize the stretch and contraction of your lats.
